sense.name: piece of land
sense.commentary: A particular piece of real estate on which something is located (or was located, or will be located).
sense.examples: We found a good site for building the school. Police gathered at the site of the accident. The forest is a highly-symbolic site for religious purposes.

sense.name: physical place, but not land
sense.commentary: A physical place that is determined by its surroundings, rather than a fixed geographical position. Usually scientific.
sense.examples: The enzyme-bonding sites are determined by a specific sequence of nucleotides. The most popular injection site is just below the shoulder.

sense.name: the Internet
sense.commentary: A page, or series of pages, on the World Wide Web.
sense.examples: The Israeli web site was damaged by hostile hackers. Many Internet sites include pictures of young ladies.
